title: Accessing Data
text: Imagine interested knowing volume, people created , agencies funded . list_volume_owners() function returns data frame information people created “” particular dataset. function parameter this_vol_id integer, unique across Databrary, refers specific dataset. list_volume_owners() function uses volume 1 default. command (many like ) can “vectorized” using purrr package. 0.6.0, get_volume_by_id() returns list data volume accessible particular user. default volume 1. Let’s create tibble/data frame subset variables. permission variable indicates whether volume visible others user. , logged-Databrary, data visible public returned. Assuming logged-, commands show volumes permission equal 1. permission field derives set constants system uses. permission array indexed beginning 0. 1th (1st) value “PUBLIC”. , 1 means volumes shown visible public, . Volumes shared visible public, permission equal 5, “ADMIN”. can’t demonstrate don’t privileges unshared volume, can try volume ’ve created yet shared. functions form list_volume_*() provide information Databrary volumes. example, list_volume_funding() command returns information funders listed project. , default volume 1. list_volume_links() command returns information external (web) links added volume, related publications GitHub repo. ’s much learn accessing Databrary information using databraryr, get started.

title: Authorized Users
text: Access restricted data requires registration formal approval institution. registration process involves creation (email-account-based) user account secure password. institutional authorization granted, user may gain access shared video, audio, data. Many commands databraryr package return meaningful results without prior formal authorization.

title: Authorized Users
text: Congratulations! institution approved access Databrary’s identifiable data. Now, ’s time set-databraryr can access materials. authorized, gain access much wider range materials Databrary. happens, ’ll load package library(databraryr) run login_db(email = "<YOUR_EMAIL@PROVIDER.COM>"), substituting actual Databrary account <YOUR_EMAIL@PROVIDER.COM>, course. prefer give package name , following thing. 0.6.0, package supports http request using httr2 package. produces far transparent responses, requires small bit preparation user’s part. First, generate store variable default http request. give request functions, needed. example, call login_db(), follows: first time ’ve logged , asked enter Databrary password separate window. everything works , see function return TRUE. Congratulations, ready access Databrary’s restricted shared information along private, unshared information access . NOTE: can save time store Databrary login (email) environment variable: Install usethis package via install.packages('usethis'). Run usethis::edit_r_environ(). open .Renviron file new window. Edit .Renviron file adding line DATABRARY_LOGIN="youremail@yourinstitution.edu", substituting actual Databrary log email. Save file, restart R. Now, can run Sys.getenv("DATABRARY_LOGIN") return Databrary login. going forward, can use Sys.getenv("DATABRARY_LOGIN") wherever enter Databrary login: NOTE: can also save even time storing Databrary user account (email) password computer’s secure credentials database using keyring package. keyring package uses encrypted file computer’s operating system uses storing passwords. alternative ways storing user credentials, recommended one. , use store overwrite parameters login_db(): overwrites securely stores credentials, next time log , need use command: ’ve stored email environment variable:
code: drq <- make_default_request() databraryr::login_db(email = "<YOUR_EMAIL@PROVIDER.COM>", rq = drq) databraryr::login_db(email = Sys.getenv("DATABRARY_LOGIN"), rq = drq) databraryr::login_db(email = "<YOUR_EMAIL@PROVIDER.COM>", store = TRUE,                      overwrite = TRUE, rq = lrq) databraryr::login_db(email = "<YOUR_EMAIL@PROVIDER.COM>", store = TRUE, rq = lrq) databraryr::login_db(email = Sys.getenv("DATABRARY_LOGIN"), store = TRUE, rq = lrq)

title: Interact with the Databrary.org API
text: Databrary (databrary.org) restricted-access research data library specialized storing sharing video capabilities storing types associated data. Access restricted data requires registration formal approval institution. registration process involves creation (email-account-based) user account secure password. institutional authorization granted, user may gain access shared video, audio, data. However, many commands databraryr package return meaningful results without prior formal authorization. commands access public data metadata.

Most developmental scientists rely on video recordings to capture the complexity and richness of behavior. However, researchers rarely share video data, and this has impeded scientific progress. Enabling reuse of video data is essential to increasing openness, maximizing the efficiency of limited resources, and accelerating the pace of discovery in the developmental and learning sciences.

We aim to provide tools that encourage good data management, facilitate open data sharing, enable discovery, and foster data reuse and integration. We are working to build functionality that allows researchers to organize, store, code, and share identifiable video data and other contextual information about the videos with other researchers through a secure web-based library.

The Databrary project is dedicated to transforming the culture of developmental science by building a community of researchers committed to open video data sharing, training a new generation of developmental scientists and empowering them with an unprecedented set of tools for discovery, and raising the profile of behavioral science by bolstering interest in and support for scientific title: databraryr 0.6.1
text: testing 0.6.0, several users installed versions R 4.0.1 use package dependency native (|>) pipe operator. version reverts using magrittr pipe (%>%).

title: databraryr 0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-02-09

title: databraryr 0.6.0
text: New make_default_request() make_login_client() functions pave way future data uploads. Revised login_db() logout_db() use httr2-style request objects. Reduce redundant calls Databrary API better filtering responses. list_{volume,session,party}* functions target volumes, sessions, parties. download_* functions download file.

title: databraryr 0.5.1
text: CRAN release: 2023-11-22

title: databraryr 0.5.1
text: Update summarize_videos_in_volume() support multiple volumes Update list_affiliates() support multiple party IDs. Update list_volume_funding() support multiple volumes. Update download_party_avatar() support multiple party IDs return list party info avatar image. Update get_party_as_df() support multiple party IDs. Update GET_db_contents(); now handles images. New download_session_zip() download_volume_zip() functions. New summarize_videos_in_volume() function support multiple volume video statistics. Update list_sessions() support multiple volumes.
